thread.title: Video: 10 of Don Orsillo's best Red Sox calls | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News
thread.title_full: Video: 10 of Don Orsillo's best Red Sox calls | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News | Boston Herald

author: Chris Mason
title: Video: 10 of Don Orsillo's best Red Sox calls | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News
text:
For the past decade and a half, Don Orsillo has been the voice of the Red Sox.
With his tenure in the NESN booth coming to a close on Sunday afternoon, it's time to look back at some of Don's biggest calls:
Hideo Nomo's no-no (2001)
Orsillo's tenure with the Sox was special from the start. In his first broadcast as the full-time play-by-play caller for the team, Hideo Nomo no-hit the Orioles.
The call: "Lifted in the air to left, O'Leary coming on and Hideo Nomo has no-hit the Baltimore Orioles!"
Clay Buchholz no-hitter (2007)
In the second start of Clay Buchholz's career, the righty hurled a no-hitter of his own against the Orioles.
The call: "Clay Buchholz has thrown a no-hitter in Boston tonight, and it sends Fenway into a frenzy!"
Jon Lester no-hitter (2008)
Orsillo was on the call when longtime ace Jon Lester tossed a no-hitter just over a year after finishing chemotherapy treatments.
The call: "Callaspo strikes out! Jon Lester has thrown a no-hitter at Fenway."
Mother's Day miracle (2007)
In one of the greatest comebacks in Red Sox history, they rallied from a 5-0 deficit in the bottom of the 9th to walk-off against the Orioles on Mother's Day.
The call: "Boston comes all the way back! A six-run ninth!"
Coco Crisp charges the mound (2008)
In a heated previous meeting, outfielder Coco Crisp had taken out Rays second baseman Akinori Iwamura with a hard slide. The next time he came to the plate against Tampa Bay, James Shields drilled him.
The call: "Shields hits Crisp annnnd... Coco is going to head out. Here we go!"
David Ortiz fights Kevin Gregg (2011)
After three straight brushback pitches, David Ortiz and Kevin Gregg finally came to blows after Ortiz popped out.
The call: "David Ortiz is going out and it's time to fight!"
David Ortiz ejection (2013)
Ejections happen all the time in baseball, but this one was special. Ortiz was tossed for arguing balls and strikes, and then teed off on the phone in the visitor's dugout at Camden Yards.
The call: "...I don't think that phone is going to work anymore."
David Ortiz walk-off (2013)
The Red Sox had 11 walk-off wins during their 2013 campaign that culminated in a World Series, and Orsillo was the voice of most of them.
The call: "A three-run homer for Big Papi, the Red Sox win in spectacular fashion!"
Brock Holt hits for the cycle (2015)
Brock Holt became the first Red Sox in almost two decades to hit for the cycle earlier this season.
The call: "The Brock star hits for the cycle."
David Ortiz hits No. 500 (2015)
Ortiz launched his 500th home run earlier this month, and Orsillo was at his best.
The call: "Big Papi, the greatest clutch hitter in Red Sox history, adds to his resume with number 500!"
